pull.title: gui: Add Close All Wallets action
pull.body: This PR adds the action to close all wallets.

issue.title: gui: Add Open External Wallet action
issue.body: This PR adds the ability to open external wallets on the GUI.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.
Rebased. Currently it creates a wallet if the folder is not a wallet, and I think this shouldn't be the case - it should show an error message "Not a wallet" or something. Will fix.
I think so? Seems harmless worst-case scenario. Can always remove later if nobody uses it.

issue.title: qt: Close All Wallets menu option should be available
issue.body:
**Currently, the File menu offers no option to close all loaded wallets at once.** 

In cases where users have many (+5) wallets loaded, the usual... 

*Open File Menu* **->** *Select Close Wallet* **->** *Answer MsgBox Question with YES* 

...can quickly become very unpleasant.

Therefore, I'd recommend to implement a new menu option, **Close All Wallets**, that can:

* Close all loaded wallets,
* but still offers the *do-you-want-to-close-this-wallet* option, in cases where only certain wallets should be closed,
* and is disabled, when there are no wallets loaded.

### UI

![close-all-wallets-menu-option](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/brakmic/bazaar/master/images/random/close-all-wallets-menu-option.png)

![close-all-wallets-automatically](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/brakmic/bazaar/master/images/random/close-all-wallets-query.png)

![close-all-wallets-disabled](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/brakmic/bazaar/master/images/random/close-all-wallets-disabled.png)

### Demo Code

I have implemented a [variant that's showcasing a possible solution](https://github.com/brakmic/bitcoin/commit/b9ffc52402e147a8e7550fcd95db2902fc2828cc), but because I:

* don't know about possible reasons to **not** include an option like this
* am not sure, if there are maybe similar solutions in the making (*have checked commit history a bit, but not thorough enough to be sure*)
* would like to know how to make a proper Qt test for it, before making a PR out of it.

Regards,

events.body:
@promag 

I have proposed a [similar solution](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/18845) yesterday but didn't know that your PR exists (*since Jan 2019 btw.*). Anyway. :)

I'd recommend to implement an **additional MsgBox** about closing all wallets automatically. This way users would be able to start the closing procedure while still having an option to keep some of their wallets open. 

![close_all_wallets](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/brakmic/bazaar/master/images/random/close-all-wallets-query.png)

This is how I implemented it in my [demo code](https://github.com/brakmic/bitcoin/commit/b9ffc52402e147a8e7550fcd95db2902fc2828cc). 

Regards,

events.message: gui: Add Close All Wallets action

events.body: Tested c4b574899abfa27f83c6948593838ed418c78f9c on Linux Mint 19.3 (x86_64) -- works as expected.

comments.body:
We want to avoid these sync calls (these create a temporary event loop) so here there's 2 options:
 - merge this and later remove all usages in the code
 - fix this one now

Not sure what is preferable.
Just use exec and a lambda?
I'm not sure if `...` is appropriate here, just for a confirmation dialog?
I know the feeling, I'm just following the "rule".
Why do you prefer `QMutexLocker` to our annotated variants?
No preference, `m_mutex` is a `QMutex` so we have to change that too.
It seems deserve its own pull :)
